title: Works as expected!
comment: I have used the app couple of times for movie tickets. No issues so far. Good job!
This app rocks! Minimum access requirements and has everything I needed: import flight ticket from mail and show at gate!
Does exactly what I needed.

title: Super easy to use
comment: Extremely helpful app for a burgeoning standard! Would welcome 1) backup to Dropbox option, 2) More details of the passes on the overview screen - sometimes I carry passes for multiple people for the same event and now I have no way of differentiating them. Cheers
Does what it suppose to do

title: Works!
comment: This morning I tested it with Aegean airlines from CHQ airport and it was flawless. Thanks. Mayne QR code should be little bigger on my HTC M8

title: Almost perfect
comment: Works like a charm. I can't seem to arrange my passes as I wish in the list tough. Therefore I can't rate this 5...

title: Need to have access to more airlines
comment: This app isn't very useful when most of the major airlines are inaccessible.
That's easier said then done ;-) I need the passes that are not working - I cannot fly all airlines for a free app ..
Simple, does the job, and only asks for an an appropriate permission (yes, singular), unlike the other passbook apps, some of which ask for pretty much all the permissions available.
Very basic but does what it is has too
Why does it need picture?
If you need the picture permission - this is for reading the SD-Card where the passbooks are often located.

Very basic, but it definitely does what is needed!  there are some features that "would be nice", though I'm not sure how possible they'd be:  1. The ability to modify the name/icon for your passes in app. 2. if the "to Calendar" button pulled more of the data from the passes when making an event, so you don't have to put them in manually.  Like I said, it does what I need it to. I like that it's clean, simple, and not clogged up with ads. The material design look fits well with my Nexus 6 running stock android!

title: Great App
comment: Use it all the time, loving it!

title: Pass Android
comment: I'm no app maven, but needed a way to download a BP that did not require internet connection.  I tried several, including this one.  I couldn't even see how to get hold of a BP once the airline had sent it to you via email and text.  The seek function didn't work at all.  There were no detailed instructions either on this site or on the app itself, that I could find.    So I went with a competitor, Passes...requires that you scan the barcode, but at least it gets it onto the phone.    If you can provide more information, I might give it a try for the next flight.  Otherwise, at least for the app-challenged, this one does not work for me.

You can do this by pressing the plus on the bottom right and create a pass - there you can scan barcode and need no internet. I like to write code - I do not like to write documentation - but feel free to contribute documentation ;-)

title: Needs impovments
comment: I have 5.5 inch screen and the QR code is too large when I click on it. I had problems with passing automatic doors at the airport. It would be nice to have an option to make it smaller.

title: Pointless
comment: The app was literally a blank screen with  non of the options shown in the screens shown here. Not sure if this is an S5 problem, but was absolutely useless to me.
Love this app perfect for us air travel

Responsive, but UI needs polish. Its probably better than the other offerings, but there's a lot of rough edges. Also doesn't display the TSA Pre-Check icon on boarding passes, which the other apps seem to support.

EDIT: My original text here was accidentally posted to the wrong app! The negative one was meant for Norwegian Airlines - THIS app I'm quite pleased with :P

title: Meh! Works, but hard to use..
comment: I've been using Pass2U for my passbook items, but decided to check this out just to see how it works. It imported a whole load of past boarding cards and filed them 'by date' above my loyalty cards (Starbucks etc). This is very annoying - I only want to see items that are current or future-dated, according to time or location. I couldn't see a way to resolve the problem of these unwanted items, other than deleting them manually, so uninstalled and back to Pass2U.

title: Works great
comment: I like it a lot. It is a no bullshit app and does exactly what it is supposed to do.  One thing to improve it would be add a setting to allow/disallow orientation changes. (Use case here is that I recently flew with Lufthansa and someone from Lufthansa wanted to check my ticket before I was entering the plane. However, that person was holding the phone in a way that the orientation changed a couple of times and the person got very confused)

thanks for the follow-up - I thought the use case is to hand the phone over with barcode in fullscreen - have to rethink that then. Perhaps an solution could be to lock orientation in the ticket detail with the orientation you started it in? So we could avoid a setting and everyone is happy?!
This app is he best
